intro: Waltheria wildii, commonly known as the wild wildflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
